data.title: Lord Rayleigh – Nobel Lecture
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Physics 1904 was awarded to Lord Rayleigh (John William Strutt) "for his investigations of the densities of the most important gases and for his discovery of argon in connection with these studies"
data.text:
Lord Rayleigh

Nobel Lecture

Nobel Lecture, December 12, 1904

The Density of Gases in the Air and the Discovery of Argon

Read the Nobel Lecture

Pdf 29 kB

From Nobel Lectures, Physics 1901-1921, Elsevier Publishing Company, Amsterdam, 1967

The Nobel Foundation's copyright has expired.

To cite this section

Nobel Prizes and laureates

Eleven laureates were awarded a Nobel Prize in 2023, for achievements that have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind. Their work and discoveries range from effective mRNA vaccines and attosecond physics to fighting against the oppression of women.

See them all presented here.
